normalized: one year has passed since the chaos arena was destroyed--
the turmoil in the world continued, unabated and unperturbed by its fall.
a man-made island floated ominously on top of tokyo bay.
its name: tokyo kingdom.
tokyo kingdom city resided on the enormous island constructed by the government.
extensive establishments and concrete buildings were clustered together there.
it was anticipated to become a second city center floating at sea and so giant enterprises had flocked there under the guidance of the government.
however, they failed to attract business and those establishments soon fell into ruin.
the island became isolated at sea with the tokyo bay subway construction work taking drastic delays, and after almost a decade, the government officially gave up.
the streets became abandoned and forgotten.
in reality, it became a ghost town, devoid of people.
nevertheless, there were people who preferred such a place.
while the transportation system was inconvenient, there was still a way of actually getting to the island.
the only way of getting on and off the island was by crossing over a ten kilometer long bridge from honshu.
anarchists, criminals, and even illegal immigrants crossed over that lengthy bridge--
and lately, so have dark inhabitants streaming over from hell.
those sorts of demons came to live there and turned the streets of the sea city into some of the most dangerous on earth.
darkness was corroding the man-made city.
it was in those very streets that i resided.
there were implicit rules in place referred to as "mutual nonintervention" that the demonic people had to abide by in ancient times.
however, people became corrupt and turned to heretical beliefs that in turn tore a seam, allowing the demons to form crime organizations and enterprises.
however, all was not lost as people rose up to walk the path of righteousness.
the government organized the taimanin, a group of ninja that were capable of opposing demons, to take on the evil indoctrinated people.
my name is, asagi-- i am a person called a taimanin who kills that evil.
however deserted the streets were and although it was home to many dangerous inhabitants, there were people who maintained order.
there were no laws outside, just street rules.
whether or not it was only the strong that survived, anyone who lived here couldn't neglect making powerful allies.
no one really knew what the exact population was.
a person that was alive one day, could turn up dead the next and criminals were always secretly coming and going in the dead of night.
the city itself contained a business district at its heart as well as one of asia's greatest prostitute grottoes.

name: sakura
normalized: …i don't know, i have a bad feeling about this
i heard my little sister, sakura, stop walking and come to a halt at the back of an alleyway, suddenly looking cautiously around her.

name: asagi
normalized: what is it?

name: sakura
normalized: for a while now…, i've had this awful feeling
she surveyed the area around her with a tense look on her face.
sakura was a taimanin the same as me--, and while she might still be quite inexperienced, her senses were far beyond that of any human.

name: asagi
normalized: there are many people living on this street, i think that's all that it is
from having glanced over the documents, it appeared that there were a considerable amount of hellish inhabitants living on this street.

name: sakura
normalized: beyond the rumors, it's sort of an amazing place, isn't it

name: asagi
normalized: do you want to go?

name: sakura
normalized: i'm joking.
but, whoever our enemies may be…

name: asagi
normalized: whatever you're feeling, they're just small game.
don't let it bother you

name: sakura
normalized: about that…wouldn't the big shots be hidden hard to detect?

name: asagi
normalized: that is why we're here to investigate--anyway, let's get going

name: sakura
normalized: okay…
we continued to walk in a long silence down the deserted alleyway as if no one was watching us.
deep inside a room in a building.
we had opened the door without a sound and gone inside.
after checking to make sure they weren't going to get ambushed by anyone, sakura slowly pulled down her mask.

name: sakura
normalized: fuu… onee-chan, it looks safe

name: asagi
normalized: sakura!

name: sakura
normalized: wha, what, onee-chan?

name: asagi
normalized: isn't it captain when in the middle of a mission?

name: sakura
normalized: ah!
that's right…captain…hehe
sakura smiled awkwardly.

name: asagi
normalized: good grief, you're lack tension

name: sakura
normalized: no, i don't

name: asagi
normalized: listen, sakura.
this is not a drill, it is a mission

name: sakura
normalized: i understand, captain

name: asagi
normalized: （i wonder if she does truly understand…）
while being amazed by sakura's attitude, i took out the mini-computer i carried.
i turned on the power and opened up communications.
sakura peered at it over my shoulder.
a highly encrypted satellite connection was established.

name: yamamoto
normalized: …yamamoto here
a man, getting up in his late 40's, appeared on the view screen.
investigation part ii - section ii
the taimanin that happened across a government controlled illegal organization, had been inserted by the psia to officially break the chaos arena scandal.
however, the government's real purpose was reforming for the sake of suppressing the taimanin's reckless nature.
the taimanin, proving they were an equal match to the dark inhabitants, had witnessed the monsters many ordinary people had become.
many of those ordinary people were government bureaucrats who couldn't help but have some kind of fear towards the taimanin.
nevertheless, the japan defense agency's nobushige yamamoto, who was no ordinary bureaucrat, was given control of the taimanin.
he spared no expense in modernizing the taimanin's equipment so that they could be more effective and imposing.
he incorporated both maintenance and aviation-vehicle personnel, giving the taimanin offensive firepower and maneuverability they never had before.
he had transformed the taimanin into an organization endowed with intelligence gathering abilities.
and now, that very same person was on the screen.

name: asagi
normalized: chief, we've made it to the restroom.
we're beginning the investigation from here

name: yamamoto
normalized: ok.
be extra careful.
something stinks about this case
his tone didn't change, but his eyes grew faintly sharp.

name: asagi
normalized: yes, roger that.
if we have enemies that can kill three taimanin, it's unacceptable to be negligent

name: yamamoto
normalized: i think i'm going to check something out using another method, because even i'm a little worried

name: asagi
normalized: another method?

name: yamamoto
normalized: if i find anything further, i'll let you know
as always, he was a person who didn't let on more than was needed.
if he was a bit more courteous, i really believed he had a serious chance at the prime minister's seat.
while he was competent, he lacked adaptability.

name: yamamoto
normalized: asagi and sakura, about this terrorist organization, investigating the whereabouts of the three taimanin is your top priority

name: asagi
normalized: roger--
ending with on a short and serious note, he promptly cut communications.

name: asagi
normalized: （what stinks….
, even the chief senses something amiss….
the reason we came to this street was to investigate the whereabouts of three taimanin.
nothing more than terror prevention was included in their assigned job by the government in control of the ninja.
nothing had been heard in over a week from the three taimanin who had infiltrated a hidden terrorist organization in "tokyo kingdom".
all three taimanin were men and were considered to be quite skilled.

name: asagi
normalized: （there is no way an ordinary terrorist organization could kill three taimanin….

name: sakura
normalized: …onee-chan?
sakura peered into my brooding face.

name: asagi
normalized: we're leaving immediately after this, sakura

name: sakura
normalized: ehh--!?
we only just got here

name: asagi
normalized: …quit complaining
ignoring sakura with a disgruntled look, i retrieved some clothes i had prepared from a closet.

name: asagi
normalized: put this on.
we're walking the streets in these

name: sakura
normalized: ehh…, but, this…

name: asagi
normalized: just listen to me, and put them on
while fuming over her lack of seriousness, i began to take off my ninja uniform.
we stepped forward into the evening's streets.
there was no getting around the small chill in the air.

name: sakura
normalized: hiehh--, why do i have to wear this?
she grimaced at the clothes that emphasized her butt and breasts.
they were highly revealing and moreover, of a thin fabric.
sakura was adamantly displeased by how much she looked like a complete slut.

name: asagi
normalized: women on this street are either prostitutes or mafia mistresses…, otherwise it depends on the mafia woman boss

name: sakura
normalized: that, might be true, but…

name: asagi
normalized: this is a mission…, got it?

name: sakura
normalized: …yes

name: asagi
normalized: from now on, when a man calls out to you, you can't refuse them right away

name: sakura
normalized: why not?

name: asagi
normalized: you have to deceive them and say whatever works to get to take you to a guest room.
okay?
understood?

name: asagi
normalized: what?
what's wrong?
she was looking at me as if she was checking out my body.

name: sakura
normalized: onee-chan…, that shape suits you so well

name: asagi
normalized: ehh…

name: sakura
normalized: that is totally ero…

name: asagi
normalized: sa, sakura!

name: sakura
normalized: wah!
i've made the captain mad!
i chased after sakura who was giggling like a child.

name: asagi
normalized: hey, wait!

name: sakura
normalized: i'm not waiting
for a moment, i had forgotten all about the mission.
no, i was just pretending to forget while chasing after sakura.
it had been one year since then--
one year since the chaos arena tragedy when i had lost kyousuke sawaki.
